title: Fluency MC meets Rachel's English on WizIQ

json.text:
>> I did not start Rachel's English at all
with an idea of what it would be.

>> Basically, I wanted to make something for
English like I wished I was finding for French,

>> ...how, how you make videos, um, how often
do you do it, how long does it take, do you

do it on your own? Do you do it with other
people's help?

>> It's such a matter of, I think, boiling
things down to the most simple units for teaching.

>> It's a very specific skill set to teach
pronunciation.
>> And she would know that better than anyone.

>> Rachel, not long ago I started teaching
in a virtual classroom on WizIQ. I got hooked.

>> Knowing people from all over the world,
it's, it's such a cool thing.

>> I was making the videos and they were getting
popular and so people were asking me, "Do

you teach?" And I hadn't yet, ever, online.
>> And that must have just really---

>> It was crazy!
>> Shocked people to hear that.

>> For every video I have, I have ideas for
a hundred more, and,

>> So imagine where she's going to go with,
uh..
